skill.description: Pattern for efficiently exploring codebases using parallel subagents. Use when you need to understand code structure, find patterns, or gather context.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill describing exploration patterns using standard Claude Code tools. No executable code, no network calls, no credential access. Only contains markdown documentation with Task, Read, Glob, and Grep tool usage patterns.

content.value_statement: Understanding large codebases takes too long when done sequentially. This skill provides patterns for spawning parallel explorer subagents to gather context quickly and produce structured summaries.
actual_capabilities: Spawn parallel explorer subagents for broad searches
Use Glob to find files by pattern
Use Grep to search file contents
Read specific files for detailed inspection
Synthesize findings into structured YAML summaries
Identify architecture patterns and integration points
limitations: Only provides patterns, does not execute exploration itself
Depends on user to specify search scope and hints
Does not analyze binary or compiled files
Cannot access external APIs or network resources

use_cases.title: Understand project structure
use_cases.description: Map out architecture and identify patterns before making design decisions.

use_cases.title: Learn codebase conventions
use_cases.description: Quickly understand coding standards, directory structure, and existing implementations.

use_cases.title: Trace code flow
use_cases.description: Find related code paths and integration points to understand how features connect.

best_practices: Start with broad exploration before diving deep into specific areas
Spawn multiple explorers in parallel to cover different areas simultaneously
Always produce structured YAML summaries to consolidate findings
Note gaps in your exploration - what you could not find matters
anti_patterns: Sequential exploration when parallel would be faster
Vague search queries without hints or scope
Skipping the synthesis step and missing patterns
Forgetting to document gaps and limitations

faq.question: What is the difference between the explorer subagent and the Explore tool?
faq.answer: The explorer subagent (lowercase) is a custom dotagent agent with structured output. The Explore tool (capitalized) is a built-in Claude Code agent with simpler behavior.

faq.question: How many explorers should I spawn at once?
faq.answer: Spawn as many as needed to cover different areas of the codebase. Parallel exploration is faster than sequential for broad understanding.

faq.question: What tools does this skill require access to?
faq.answer: Task, Read, Glob, and Grep tools are required. These are standard Claude Code tools that require user permission.

faq.question: Is my code data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads files and produces summaries. No data is sent externally or stored beyond the current session.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my codebase?
faq.answer: No. The skill only provides exploration patterns using read-only tools. It cannot write files or execute arbitrary code.

faq.question: How is this different from a grep search?
faq.answer: Grep finds specific patterns. This skill uses parallel subagents to understand context, identify patterns, and synthesize findings across multiple areas.
